generif.text: a powerful growth suppressor controlling pituitary cell proliferation and the first identified gene whose expression is lost in the majority of human pituitary tumors.
results suggest that CRIF1 is a novel nuclear protein that interacts with Gadd45 and may play a role in negative regulation of cell cycle progression and cell growth
Data show that GADD45 gamma mRNA expression is down-regulated in hepatocellular carcinoma, and that GADD45 gamma causes cell cycle arrest at G2/M transition when transfected into Hep-G2 cells.

GADD45g induction by androgens requires new protein synthesis; overexpression of GADD45g inhibited cell growth and caused morphological changes in prostate cell lines, arguing that GADD45g is involved in differentiation induced by androgens
Inhibition of GADD45alpha and gamma in cancer cells by small interfering RNA abrogates apoptosis induction by the inhibitor of NF-kappaB
Results show that GADD45G can act as a functional new-age tumor suppressor but being frequently inactivated epigenetically in multiple tumors.
Establish MDA-7/IL-24 and GADD45alpha and GADD45gamma as critical mediators of apoptosis and growth arrest in response to NSAIDs in cancer cells.
Human Gadd45gamma and its selenomethionine derivative were expressed in an Escherichia coli expression system and purified; they were then crystallized using the hanging-drop vapour-diffusion method.

Flow cytometric analysis revealed significant G2/M arrest in cells transfected with either Gadd45alpha or Gadd45gamma. Importantly, we found that expression of either Gadd45alpha or Gadd45gamma activated P38 and JNK kinase pathways to induce G2/M arrest.

urinary GADD45gamma expression is associated with progression of renal disease
Epigenetic regulation of GADD45G is associated with carcinogenesis in stomach, colorectal and pancreateic cancers.
The induction of GADD45gamma gene expression by 1,25-(OH)2D3 may mark therapeutic response in prostate cancer.
clinically non-functioning adenomas had a significant decrease (P<0.001) in the relative levels of GADD45c expression (13 of 14 adenomas or 92%), compared to functioning adenomas (11 of 24 or 46%)
Data show that mda-7/IL-24 activation leads to upregulation of growth arrest and DNA damage inducible (GADD) 45 alpha and gamma and JNK activation.
These results reveal the mechanism of self-association by Gadd45 proteins and the importance of this self-association for their biological function

Methylation-mediated repression of GADD45G expression is associated with gastric cardia adenocarcinoma.
Decreased expression and aberrant methylation of Gadd45G is associated with tumor progression in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.
GADD45G functions as a negative regulator of the Jak-Stat3 pathway and inhibits hepatocellular carcinoma by inducing cellular senescence.
The gadd45g gene has both tumor suppressor and tumor promoter functions, dependent on the tissue/cell type and transforming event. (Review)
Suggest that cucurbitacin E induced mitosis delay is regulated by GADD45gamma overexpression in malignant gliomas.
Expression of GADD45gamma was significantly higher in pituitary adenomas of female patients.

demonstrate for the first time that miR-383 can specifically regulates the expression of Gadd45g by directly targeting to the 3-UTR region of Gadd45g mRNA, a regulatory process conserved in human tumor cells and mouse embryonic stem cells

In contrast to solid tumors, in DLBCL, the frequency of GADD45gamma methylation is higher and may be associated with progression. Nodal involvement is more likely to be present in patients with unmethylated GADD45gamma.
we demonstrated that GADD45gamma expression in hepatocellular carcinoma cells was associated with sorafenib sensitivity
Results establish that the dowregulation of GADD45G-SIP1 axis may contribute to cellular senescence evasion and HCC development.

PAX5 was found to be an epigenetically inactivated tumor suppressor that inhibited non-small-cell lung proliferation and metastasis, through down-regulating the beta-catenin pathway and up-regulating GADD45G expression.
In addition to changes in MEK3 gene regulation, our study demonstrated upregulation of CACNG2 and GADD45G at the mRNA level in CMM patients.

In an Eastern Chinese population, carriers of GADD45G rs8252T variant genotypes had a significantly lower risk of NSCLC. rs8252 variant CT/TT carriers showed significantly higher levels of GADD45G mRNA expression than CC carriers in the target tissues. There was some evidence of interactions between rs8252 genotypes and sex in NSCLC risk.
HSV-1 causes upregulation of the GADD45gamma gene to prevent the upregulation of innate immunity genes.
this is the first study to show that GADD45gamma is required for the caspase-dependent apoptosis of renal tubular cells induced by nephrotoxic drugs.

summary: This gene is a member of a group of genes whose transcript levels are increased following stressful growth arrest conditions and treatment with DNA-damaging agents. The protein encoded by this gene responds to environmental stresses by mediating activation of the p38/JNK pathway via MTK1/MEKK4 kinase. The GADD45G is highly expressed in placenta. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
